question: If P = i + 2j - 4k and Q = i + 2j - k then (P + Q) . (P - Q) is
question_latex: If $\vec{P}=\hat{i}+2\hat{j}-4\hat{k}$ and $\vec{Q}=\hat{i}+2\hat{j}-\hat{k}$ then $(\vec{P}+\vec{Q})\cdot(\vec{P}-\vec{Q})$ is

question: The resultant of P and Q is R. If Q is doubled, the new resultant is perpendicular to P. Then R is [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: The resultant of $\vec{P}$ and $\vec{Q}$ is $\vec{R}$. If $\vec{Q}$ is doubled, the new resultant is perpendicular to $\vec{P}$. Then $R$ is [MHT-CET 2019]
solution:
Condition for perpendicular resultant: $\vec{P} \cdot (\vec{P} + 2\vec{Q}) = 0 \Rightarrow P^2 + 2PQ\cos\theta = 0 \Rightarrow PQ\cos\theta = -P^2/2$. 
 Magnitude of $R$: $R^2 = P^2 + Q^2 + 2PQ\cos\theta = P^2 + Q^2 - P^2 = Q^2$. 
 Thus $R = Q$.

question: A force F = 5i + 2j + k acts on a particle at position r = i - j + k. The torque about the origin is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: A force $\vec{F} = 5\hat{i} + 2\hat{j} + \hat{k}$ acts on a particle at position $\vec{r} = \hat{i} - \hat{j} + \hat{k}$. The torque about the origin is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution:
$\vec{\tau} = \vec{r} \times \vec{F} = \begin{vmatrix} \hat{i} & \hat{j} & \hat{k} \\ 1 & -1 & 1 \\ 5 & 2 & 1 \end{vmatrix} = \hat{i}(-1 - 2) - \hat{j}(1 - 5) + \hat{k}(2 - (-5)) = -3\hat{i} + 4\hat{j} + 7\hat{k}$. 
 (Re-check: $\hat{i}(-3) - \hat{j}(-4) + \hat{k}(7) = -3\hat{i} + 4\hat{j} + 7\hat{k}$. If answer is C, check sign convention).

question: Three vectors A, B and C are such that A = B + C and their magnitudes are in ratio 13: 12:5. The angle between vectors A and C is [2025]
question_latex: Three vectors $\vec{A}, \vec{B}$ and $\vec{C}$ are such that $\vec{A} = \vec{B} + \vec{C}$ and their magnitudes are in ratio $13: 12:5$ respectively. The angle between vectors $\vec{A}$ and $\vec{C}$ is [2025]
solution: $13^2 = 12^2 + 5^2$ ($169 = 144 + 25$). This forms a right-angled triangle where $A$ is the hypotenuse. $\cos\theta = C/A = 5/13 \Rightarrow \theta = \cos^{-1}(5/13)$.

question: The angle between two vectors A = 3i + 4j and B = 4i - 3j is [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: The angle between two vectors $\vec{A} = 3\hat{i} + 4\hat{j}$ and $\vec{B} = 4\hat{i} - 3\hat{j}$ is [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: $\vec{A} \cdot \vec{B} = (3 \times 4) + (4 \times -3) = 12 - 12 = 0$. Since the dot product is zero, the angle is $90^{\circ}$.
